description: multi scheduler always uses the Scheduler class (driver.py) version of live_migration vs using the compute_scheduler_driver version.  Currently no other schedulers override schedule_live_migration, so it's not a problem...  but it could be a problem at some point.
title: multi scheduler doesn't proxy live_migration

comments.content: multi scheduler always uses the Scheduler class (driver.py) version of live_migration vs using the compute_scheduler_driver version.  Currently no other schedulers override schedule_live_migration, so it's not a problem...  but it could be a problem at some point.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens

comments.content:
Chris,

My comment is not related to live_migration but more about the multi scheduler. 
I am trying to evaluate its value and its reliability . How did you setup yours? I couldn't find a documentation about it... The official Essex doc just has 1 line about it.

Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~warik

comments.content: Looks like you're not working on that anymore. Please set back to InProgress and reassign to you if you're working on proposing a change for merging.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
